text: State unemployment rates in April ranged from 7.9% in Connecticut to 28.2% in Nevada.
April unemployment reached a 40-year high in 43 states, including Hawaii.
All 50 states saw a decline in state and local public employment from March to April.
State and local public education employment in Wisconsin declined 20% from last April.
Six states saw private-sector employment fall more than 20% compared with last April.
In April, average private-sector weekly earnings ranged from $762 in MS to $1,745 in DC.
Only AK and WV saw a year-over-year decline in house prices from Q1 2019 to Q1 2020.
Washington’s annual house price growth has exceeded the US average each quarter since 2014.
Texas and Utah saw the largest year-over-year increase in GDP from Q4 2018 to Q4 2019.
